# BlogPost 4 - Second Milestone

### Milestones

This milestone quickly messed up our overall structure of the milestones. This milestone we wanted to focus on the power ups, however to test some of the power ups it is required to have some functions that are planned in the next milestone. The other focus is the inventory, more specifically the UI parts. Therefore the new milestones now look like this

Old:

1. Physics and rope mechanic - Map and camera
2. Collectables (Power ups and rewards) mechanical, sound, graphics and animations,
3. World and level. Moving platforms, difficulty and puzzles, Menu, Collectables, inventory

New

1. Physics and rope mechanic - Map and camera
2. Power ups, graphics, moving platforms and objects, Menu and inventory
3. World creating, Collectables, Sound, Animation

Since we wanted to focus on the power ups we also wanted to implement inventory. This fell into UI parts which also meant that the menu got included in this milestone. This is also where we ended up choosing which power ups is will be implemented the list is:![](data:image/png;base64,)
![power-up](pictures/blog4.png)
1. Time control
2. Shrink
3. Dash
4. Double jump
5. Phase
6. Push

There are active power ups like Time control and push that interacts with in game objects, such as moving platforms and boxes. Originally we wanted the world objects to be implemented in the last milestone but to test if the power ups actually works it had to be implemented in this milestone. Focusing on this is the reason why we ended up not focusing on sound and animation in this milestone. And graphics is something we ended up doing along the whole project since we used public assets.

### Power up

The script _PlayerPowerupHandler_ manages all logic for the different power ups. This should probably have been split up into more scripts and have used the state design pattern. Instead there are switch cases inside the class that handle the different active power ups. There are 2 types of power ups. Actives and passives. Actives have a method that handles the logic when using the power button, except for sizing power up that changes a local value on the player. Passives immediately activates the powerup through a method when it’s chosen through the inventory

### UI

There are 3 different UI’s. Menu, Pause and Inventory. The Menu and Pause are made with the same components and GameObjects. The UI consists of a panel with buttons and has an EventSystem. Each button has a method that handles its logic and is called when it’s clicked. The EventSystem allows you to use your inputs and select the first selected position. The Menu is in a different scene that continues over to the Main scene. The Pause UI pauses everything and prohibits the game to read player movement inputs and uses UI player inputs.

The inventory is a bit different and with custom scripts. The inventory is a shared inventory. In this UI there is a PlayerSelector and VisualSelector for each player. This gives the players the ability to differentiate themselves in the inventory and choose their own powerup. The inventory itself has the scripts that tracks what power ups the player has picked up.
